description.raw:
Some homebrew builds have been failing recently with the following error message:

~~~
+++ export HOMEBREW_UPDATE_TO_TAG=1
+++ HOMEBREW_UPDATE_TO_TAG=1
+++ /usr/local/bin/brew update
Error: Another active Homebrew update process is already in progress.
Please wait for it to finish or terminate it to continue.
Build step 'Execute shell' marked build as failure
~~~

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo7-homebrew-amd64/118/console

I was able to reproduce this failure locally on the test machine, but only after setting the `HOMEBREW_UPDATE_TO_TAG` variable to 1. After reading a [github issue](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/issues/1155#issuecomment-249688363), I saw that it was related to `git gc` breaking the state of the brew repo. A `git fsck` is enough to fix it; so I've added that to our CI scripts. Here's a test build with this branch:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo7-homebrew-amd64/119/
